private_information: I can drive between places; while driving I am not at any place
truck0.goal: Help transport crates as needed so the global goal is achieved.

private_information: I can drive between places; while driving I am not at any place
truck1.goal: Help transport crates as needed so the global goal is achieved.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift, putdown, load, and unload crates with durations depending on my power
If I lift a crate I become not available until I finish putting it down or loading it
hoist0.goal: Provide lifting, loading, unloading, and placing operations to achieve the global goal.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift, putdown, load, and unload crates with durations depending on my power
hoist1.goal: Provide lifting, loading, unloading, and placing operations to achieve the global goal.

private_information: I stay at my place and can lift, putdown, load, and unload crates with durations depending on my power
hoist2.goal: Provide lifting, loading, unloading, and placing operations to achieve the global goal.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the environment goal while respecting agent constraints and minimizing total time.

public_information: There are places: depot0, distributor0, distributor1
Trucks move between places taking time distance/speed
Hoists perform all pick/place/load/unload operations and stay at their place
Crates can be on surfaces or in trucks; surfaces include pallets and crates

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL problems involving mobile trucks and stationary hoists coordinating to move crates. You will be given the environment initial state, numeric fluents (distances, speeds, weights, powers), and constraints for each agent. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models temporal actions with start, over all, and end conditions and effects, numeric fluents for durations, and distinct actions for each agent type. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Respect the given initial state and goal without adding extra assumptions. Ensure the domain models drive durations = distance/speed, hoist load/unload durations = weight/power, lift/putdown duration = 1, and that trucks are not at any place while driving.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The trucks' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information} and {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The hoists' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, and {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated temporal and numeric model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
